comment.text: This translation key is used to display the single sign-on setting. It appears on a provider settings page or in related UI elements, where users can configure their single sign-on options. The content of this key should be translated to describe the purpose and functionality of single sign-on for the specific use case it is displayed in.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Bulgarian translation 'Единично влизане' while technically meaning 'Single entry,' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Single sign-on.' The correct term should reflect the concept of a unified authentication process across multiple applications or services.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be 'Унифициран вход' or 'Единствен вход', which more closely represents 'Single sign-on'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation includes a space before the katakana. This is unnecessary and disrupts readability.

The Korean translation "싱글 사인온" is a direct transliteration of "Single sign-on" and doesn't convey the meaning clearly for Korean speakers. It's essentially just writing the English phrase in Korean characters.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more descriptive Korean translation, such as "단일 로그인" (dan-il lo-gin), which directly translates to 'single login'. Alternatively, '통합 로그인' (tong-hap lo-gin) could be used, meaning 'integrated login'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "ການເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບດ້ວຍບຸສິ້ນດຽວ" is a literal translation of "Single sign-on", it's not the most natural or commonly used term in Lao. It sounds somewhat technical and clunky.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more common Lao equivalent, such as "ການເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບແບບດຽວ" or "ການເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບດ້ວຍສຳປະນິດດຽວ".  The best choice will depend on the context and target audience.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Dutch translation 'Single Sign-On' does not follow typical Dutch capitalization rules for proper nouns. While 'Single Sign-On' is acceptable, capitalizing both words is less common.

While "තනි පිවිසුම" (thani pivisuma) can be interpreted as 'single access' or 'single entry', it doesn't directly convey the meaning of 'single sign-on' which implies a unified authentication process. A more accurate translation would capture the 'sign-on' aspect.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: තනි ඇතුළුවීම (thani athuluvim) - This translates more closely to 'single login' or 'single authentication', capturing the essence of 'single sign-on'.
